Pre-Game Insights: Coach Tuka Tisam from Cook Islands is confident in his team's preparation and believes they're ready to go on match day.
Coach Kilifi Uele from Tonga emphasizes the importance of planning and preparation for the team.
Coach Shani Simpson from American Samoa believes that his team is slowly getting there and is excited about the World Cup campaign.
Coach Jess Ibrom from Samoa is aware of the additional pressure that comes with being the host nation and is confident in his team's ability to represent Samoa well.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2026 FIFA World Cup is the first with a guaranteed qualification spot for an Oceania side after a restructuring of the tournament format to 48 participating teams.
The runners-up in the Oceania qualifiers in March 2025 will get a second chance to reach the finals, going into the FIFA Intercontinental play-off tournament.
Others: The match between Cook Islands and Tonga will determine which team advances to meet either American Samoa or Samoa in the final match on Monday.
The match between American Samoa and Samoa will take place on Friday at 2pm (NZT) at the Football Federation Samoa Football Stadium.
